comment.author: 82967752@N00
comment._content: George V and May of Teck. Crowned 22nd June 1911 at Westminster Abbey. So this is not the Coronation if it is at St George's Chapel, Windsor. It doesn't really look grand enough for a coronation. George V bears a striking resemblance to his first cousin, Tsar Nicholas II of Russia.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The robes are those of the Order of the Garter. Assuming that this was taken on the same day as www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163490798/ it was on June 10, 1911, when the Prince of Wales (future Edward VIII) was invested with the Order of the Garter. According to query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A00E6D71031E233A... this was seen as the beginning of the coronation celebrations.

comment.author: 23349436@N07
comment._content: This is definitely the Garter Ceremony, not the Coronation.

comment.author: 90983012@N00
comment._content: What a fascinating photo ! King George with his German wife as a Sovereign of the Most Noble Order of the Garter !

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content:
Thanks to all for your observations and comments!  This does appear to be June 10, 1911, after the Prince of Wales (Edward VIII) was invested with the Order of the Garter in St. George's Chapel at Windsor Castle.  It was linked to the series of state functions leading up to George V's coronation on June 22, 1911 at Westminster Abbey.  

We will add more information to the descriptive data to make it clearer which event is being shown.

comment.author: 90983012@N00
comment._content: You are most welcome. I had the honour and pleasure to know the last living grandson of the last German Emperor personally. We spoke often about his English relatives. The Kaiser was the oldest grandson of Queen Victoria. Here you can see my links. www.flickr.com/photos/90983012@N00/2368357761/in/set-7215... www.flickr.com/photos/90983012@N00/2368658269/in/set-7215...

comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called STREET collection, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 27242630@N02
comment._content: The earlier posted comments made it clear that this image is not the King and Queen and The Library of Congress posted a comment 6 months ago that more information would be added to make it clear which event is shown but that doesn't seem to have been done.  How long does it usually take to act on comments?   Surely not 6 months ( I hope).

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Unfortunately, we are almost exactly 6 months behind in updating records. This description is now edited by hand, rather than wait longer to correct the source record and reload the description here. It's nice to know that the updates are appreciated and, hopefully, we'll get more resources soon and be able to keep up better with the flood of new info.
